data: If ready patient can be discharged 60 to 120 minutes post completion of infusion if vital signs and status remain stable
If ready patient can be discharged 60 minutes post completion of infusion if vital signs and status remain stable
If ready patient can be discharged 120 minutes post completion of infusion if vital signs and status remain stable
Baseline heart rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure and temperature prior to infusion then q15min for 1 hour, then q30min during infusion, at end of infusion q1h for two hours
Baseline prior to infusion then q15m for 1 hour, then q30min during infusion, at end of infusion q1h for 2 hours
May Use Implanted Vascular Access Device
Label the pump for the intracerebroventricular (ICV) infusion "ICV Infusion only"

Codman Holter Rickham device to be accessed by Biochemical Genetics provider.  Assess patient for systemic or local infection, edema, erythema, or leaking at the Codman Holter Rickham reservoir site. Do not access the ICV device or administer cerliponase alfa if there are signs and symptoms of acute ICV access device leakage, device failure, or device-related infection. Notify Neurosurgeon on call if there is any swelling, erythema of the scalp, extravasation of fluid, or bulging of the scalp around or above the ICV access device on assessment
Report patient arrival to Biochemical Genetics provider on call to assess patient and access Codman Holter Rickman reservoir
Notify central pharmacy once Codman Holter Rickham reservoir has been accessed to request cerliponase alfa be prepared for infusion
Notify on-call Biochemical Genetics provider to remove needle from Codman Holter Rickham reservoir post infusion and flush
